#Text=Surf 's up in Chile ; championship competition in Pichilemu
#Text=Thursday , May 20 , 2010
#Text=Promotional poster of the championship .
#Text=The famous rocks of Punta de Lobos .
#Text=The Surf Championship Competition , " Ceremonial Quiksilver Pichilemu 2010 " , took place on Wednesday in the Chilean city nicknamed " Capital of the Surf " , Pichilemu .

column1: #Text=Waves nine meters high or larger were predicted in Punta de Lobos , sixkilometers from the urban centre of Pichilemu .
#Text=Some of the most important surfers were in the championship , the South African Grant
#Text=" Twiggy " Baker , Hawaiians Jamie Sterling and Mark Healey , as well as the Chilean Ramón Navarro , who won the Master Drop award last December , the 10-meters " hellish wave " in Hawaii .
#Text=The weather conditions in Pichilemu have been fine recently and the tides are optimum .
#Text=" This Championship will be one of the best in the big waves circuit .

#Text=The competitors are the following , by class : first class : Carlos Burle ( Brazil ) ,  Twiggy " Baker ( South Africa ) , Jamie Sterling ( United States ) , Cristián Merello ( Chile ) , Ismael Herreros ( Chile ) and Alejandro Martínez ( Chile ) ; second class : Mark Healey ( United States ) , Danilo Couto ( Brazil ) , Marcos Monteiro ( Brazil ) , Fernando Zegers ( Chile ) , Pato Texeira ( Brazil ) and Reinaldo Ibarra ( Chile ) ; third class : Peter Mel ( United States ) , Kohl Christensen ( United States ) , Ramón Navarro ( Chile ) , Cristóbal González ( Chile ) , Fabián Farías ( Chile ) and Santiago Di Pace ( Argentina ) ; fourth class : Diego Medina ( Chile ) , Greg Long ( United States ) , Gabriel Villarán ( Peru ) , León Vicuña ( Chile ) , Anthony Tashnick ( United States ) and Ben Wilkerson ( United States ) .

column1: #Text=The final charts were :
#Text=#NameCountry 1 Cristián Merelló Pichilemu , Chile 2Gabriel Villarán Peru 3Peter Mel USA 4Jamie Sterling USA 5Mark Healey USA 6Greg Long USA
#Text=From the 24 surfers , just six contested the final of the championship .
#Text=The Peruvian Gabriel Villarán obtained the second place , meanwhile the most-known Ramón Navarro , just managed to reach semifinals .
#Text=The final phase of the competition lasted after 45 minutes .
#Text=Merelló managed to pass one of the giant waves perfectly .
#Text=Diego Medina , also Chilean , received the Big Drop and Surf Spirit awards , recognition given by the other competitors .

#Text=More than a thousand people went to Punta de Lobos to attend the championship , one of them the Mayor of Pichilemu , Roberto Córdova , with some O'Higgins Sernatur ( National Tourism Service ) officials .
#Text=However , the tour has n't ended , and the beaches of California , Peru , South Africa and Hawaii are left .
